item.title: Backing up and restoring the Linux configuration
item.description: Linux stores the configuration and settings in a dconf database that consists of a single file in binary format. The format is defined as gvdb (GVariant Database file). It is a simple database file format that stores a mapping from strings to GVariant values in a way that is extremely efficient for lookups. The GNOME database file for each user is by default ~/.config/dconf/user. To explore/edit the dconf database, you can use the dconf Editor.
